result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell A Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ORDER - appeal rights are reinstated.

FURTHER ORDER - the time to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is extended to November 23, 2016.

FURTHER ORDER - the time to act under WIS STAT RULE 809.30(2)(e) or (f) commence as of the date of this order.
Order - within 30 days of the date of this order the State shall advise whether it objects to reinstating Greer's 809.30 statute appeal rights from the June 2016 sentencing

Court orders that the motion to extend the time to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is held in abeyance pending proof of service upon the Attorney General.
AND
Court orders that no later then December 20, 2016, counsel shall provide this court with an affidavit of service for the extension motion dated December 5, 2016.

records.addlTxt:
11:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase on 2014CF143 only.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Haase.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF143 

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-DNA Sample

Court will not grant expungement and states reasons.

2014CF14 - Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court in regards to the PD's office appointing counsel.  Atty Haase confirms that the PD's office is not able to find an attorney.  Court will appoint an attorney and will appoint Atty Max Saylor.  Court instructs the defendant to fill out the petition for court appointed counsel and defendant is to contact Atty Saylor ASAP. 

Court adjourned at 11:36 a.m
By Atty Jeffrey Haase
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.

9:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Atty Jeffrey Haase present via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - attempted to contact four attorneys and can't afford one.  Statement by Atty Haase - would be able to represent him on the bail jumping, but not on the other case.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by Atty Haase - will represent the defendant on this matter and the other case will track with this one.  Court will have the JA schedule a hearing.

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.
to the defendant from Circuit Court re counsel
Status hearing on May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

9:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Defendant - waiting for the files to start calling attorneys.  Statement by the Court.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 31, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:44 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:05 a.m.

11:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Paul Zilles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - Atty Zilles has filed a motion to withdraw.  Atty Zilles requests to withdraw.  Statement by defendant - no longer wants Atty Zilles to represent him.  Further statement by Atty Zilles.  Statement by ADA Vanden Branden.  Court grants the motion to withdraw.  Atty Zilles to submit a motion to withdraw for judge to sign.  Court makes statement to the defendant - will not allow the next attorney to withdraw.  Statement by ADA - is withdrawing offer.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 1, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status hearing at 03-16-2015 01:00 pm

10:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - has received a letter that the defendant requests Atty Haase withdraw from the case.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by Atty Haase.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.  No objection by ADA.   Court grants the motion and requests the PD's office to appoint a new attorney.  Court will set for status hearing on March 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:24 a.m.
from Atty Jeffrey Haase dated February 13, 2015
Status hearing on March 17, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

1:27 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Haase and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Haase enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing in 30-60 days.

Court adjourned at 1:29 p.m.
By Atty Jeffrey Haase
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Defendant now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the court read it to him.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court goes over right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant requests to contact an attorney.  Court sets for preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
